stream_context.summary: Kaze postpones work on the Oil Blarrg boss and spends most of the stream polishing course-select backdrops: importing a new submarine model, debugging its sine-wave bob, and building an animated ‘bird in a tree’ screen for Lofty Lumberleafs. He also brainstorms future level themes and explains that he and Zeina are moving house the next day, so development will pause for a week.

development_findings.summary: Cut-scene tweak: after the Oil Blarrg swallows Mario, it will spit him out so he lands on the opposite side of the arena, improving clarity for players.
development_findings.quote: Maybe after he comes out of here we just have an animation of him spitting out Mario and Mario goes and lands over here.

development_findings.summary: Boss balance: extra coins and descending platforms will be added because the fight is currently ‘too hard’.
development_findings.quote: I think I wanted more coins in this area because this boss is a bit too hard right now, especially once we add these things going down.

development_findings.summary: Submarine asset: switched several textures from CI8 to IA8/I8, removed unnecessary Nth Color settings and baked vertex colours to keep performance while improving visual quality.

Submarine motion: Implemented Y-axis and roll sine-wave (≈40-frame loop) but uncovered a GCC quirk that linked an incorrect sine table when mathf.h wasn’t included, causing wild values; fixed by explicitly including the correct table.
development_findings.quote: How did it just link the sine table to a random thing instead of telling me that there's no sine table?

development_findings.summary: Guideline for collectibles: in RTYI every star hovers 200 units above floor and every box 300; adjusted a mis-placed star in Lofty Lumberleafs to conform.

Bird star-select screen: imported Biobak’s model, added subtle bobbing clouds (vertex-animated), bird idles then flies toward camera on A-press; discovered Star-Select code freezes object updates during fade-out and planned to refactor so animation continues.
Lighting artefacts on lighthouse beams were fixed by switching to a combined colour/alpha texture and widening the beam spacing; vertex-colour banding was reduced.
Overworld will be completely rebuilt as a single tropical island inspired by a Mario Party board; teleports and placeholders shown in current builds will be removed.
development_findings.quote: I think we should theme the island for the overworld like this… nice and tropical.

development_findings.summary: Performance headroom: the underwater course holds 60 FPS on real N64, so Kaze plans to ‘go sicko mode’ by populating it with many fish and jellyfish.
Planned future courses: Wild West (catching evildoers), possible Casino, Comic-book Superhero City, Arctic ‘ice-cream-train’ zone; explicitly rejected a ‘music-themed’ level.
development_findings.quote: Music level sounds like shit. I don't actually like that idea.

development_findings.summary: Retro throwback stages list (still tentative): Paper Mario 64 Goomba Town, Mario Paint, Dr. Mario, Mario Land 1, Smash 64; open to replacements if better ideas arise.
Content boundaries: rejected adding a ‘femboy’ NPC because it carries sexual connotations; wants family-friendly tone.
development_findings.quote: I would not want him to be referred to as a femboy, because that seems like a sexual thing.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina move house tomorrow; next stream will be from his new ‘dungeon’ office after a week off.
context_findings.quote: Next stream is not going to be here anymore… I am going to have my own dungeon.

context_findings.summary: Excitement over YouTube success: the ‘10,000 Triangles’ video is outperforming recent uploads; a Fast Inverse Square Root video is in production.
context_findings.quote: This video got more views in like not even two hours than most videos get in a day.

context_findings.summary: Design principle: Kaze avoids putting overt references to himself ingame so future controversies won’t tarnish the project.
context_findings.quote: The player shouldn't even know that I exist when he plays this game… if I get cancelled, no one has to put down the game.

context_findings.summary: He isn’t a Sonic fan and avoids direct Sonic homages; prefers ideas rooted in Mario canon or original twists.
Comfort with public critique: says he ‘likes being judged’ and invites feedback openly.

biobak.summary: Provided new star-select assets (submarine, lighthouse beams, bird model) and requested specific lighting and motion adjustments.
Collaborated live on colour-banding and fog issues; suggested slowing wave animation by 0.5 and adding subtle horizontal bob.
French; was cooking during stream—running joke about viewers guessing the meal.

zeina.summary: Active in chat; confirmed preference for male characters when discussing DDM64; shared opinion that all dating-sim NPCs are ‘terrible’.
Moving house with Kaze; expects to film a new house-tour video.

key_stories.title: The Submarine Sine-Wave Bug
key_stories.summary: While adding a gentle bobbing motion to the new submarine model, Kaze found the object teleporting wildly. The culprit was a missing math include that caused GCC to link garbage data for the sine table.
key_stories.challenge: Implement smooth sine-wave translation and roll without breaking performance.
key_stories.process: Profiled values, printed debug output, realised sinf() pulled from wrong symbol table; explicitly included mathf.h and recast to s16.
key_stories.outcome: Animation now stable; motion parameters tuned to ~40-frame loop.
key_stories.key_quote: How did it just link the sine table to a random thing instead of telling me that there's no sine table?

key_stories.title: Re-imagining the Overworld
key_stories.summary: During a casual Mario Party session, the team decided the current overworld felt bland. Kaze now wants a single, tropical island hub styled like a Mario Party board.
key_stories.challenge: Current overworld uses placeholder teleports and feels disjointed.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed themes live; agreed on tropical aesthetic with potential sunset lighting and boat travel.
key_stories.outcome: Existing overworld will be scrapped and rebuilt; future streams will cover layout and art.
key_stories.key_quote: We can absolutely add sunsets in it… theme the island like this, nice and tropical.

key_stories.title: Animating the Star-Select Bird
key_stories.summary: Biobak delivered a bird perched on a branch for Lofty Lumberleafs’ course-select. Kaze integrated the model, added bobbing clouds, and programmed a take-off animation triggered by A-press, but discovered the Star-Select engine pauses object updates during fade-out.
key_stories.challenge: Make the bird feel alive and ensure it flies into screen before level load.
key_stories.process: Imported model, adjusted transforms, tweaked cloud vertex animation, identified object-freeze bug.
key_stories.outcome: Visuals complete; needs code refactor so animation continues during fade.
key_stories.key_quote: Everything just freezes when I press A… I need the animation to keep playing while the fade-out happens.
